Fer fucks sake. Chasing kids trying to run from me in a golf cart is not how I wanted to spend my Friday night....
Did you catch them?
Also, what did they do?
Bout a dozen kids fucking around in somebody else's house under construction. 8 of them were reasonable. 2 tried booking it in the golf cart.
When I say kids, I mean 15-18 btw.
savages
Called the parents of the kids who had invited their friends to the party.
"Hey Mrs. So-and-so, I have your kids and most of their friends here, are there two other kids at your house that took a golf cart to get there?"
"Huh, no, they should all be.... Wait, two of them just pulled into my driveway.... What happened this time, Dadrobit..."
"if you do not send the apology letter and come to pick them up in the next 15 minutes i'm going to start executing them every minute"
"Can you start with billy? we will be there in 16 minutes-"

Long story short, no more friends for a long time, and no more golf cart privileges. I also had to wait around while their parents arrived so I could explain to all of them that their kids are lucky as fuck that I was called instead of the police...
When I say under construction, I mean 99.5% complete. Foyer chandelier lights up and everything.
jeez-
So these idiots were just
in someones house
"having fun" in someone else very legitimate home.
that's messed up
Had to do a "quick" inspection to make sure there was no obvious damage, but it still took a while. Big fuckin mansion.
Thankfully the kids that stayed knew they were fucked enough and didn't try screwing with me any more than what had transpired.
what gave them the idea that was a "proper" thing to do? are were they just idiots?

It's just.... Ughhhh. The family in general is one of my favorite groups of people. Real decent folks. Fuckin sucks that their sons decided to screw up like this and I have to give them all the bad guy talk.
better than "your kids were tresspassing and now are all dead"
Teenage kids, sun. Having a little party for the sake of a party. Told the parents they were just gonna hang out at the top of the mountain. Big idiot mistakes.

One of my favorite D & D moments...playing a Tengu Ranger, I was trying to find a specific location in an enemy stronghold. I goofed and got noticed by a couple of orc guards.

Being that I wasn't human, I dropped the name of someone I had heard about in passing and pretended I was lost and looking for the cafeteria. Rolled a nat 19 on my bluff and managed to avoid a conflict.
Not a huge story, but I was glad I could think on my feet.
